title: The 'expected' story of the Premier League season: nine revelations about 2019/20 so far thanks to xG
text:
The Premier League table after eight games tells a story but there is more to the season so far than meets the eye.

Opta's expected goals metric - which allocates a value to every shot to show how good a chance it is (or what the expectation is that it should be scored) - provides a helpful additional tool in attempting to find out the truth behind the table.

Do Leicester really deserve to be where they are? Are Manchester United as bad as their position and points tally suggests? Is Liverpool's form sustainable? Will Watford ever win a game?

Here, we try to tell work out what the Premier League table is hiding using expected goals.

Leicester's goal-scoring is not sustainable

Leicester have looked hugely impressive this season. They have beaten Spurs, drawn with Chelsea, ran Liverpool close this weekend and look the most likely team to break the 'big six' in a good few years.

But despite the positive feeling around Brendan Rodgers' team and their place in the top four as we head into this international break, Leicester will need to improve to maintain their position.
description: The Premier League table after eight games tells a story but there is more to the season so far than meets the eye.
